medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2 am with acute pain that radiated across the upper abdomen, waking her from sleep. The pain was constant from an unspecified time in the morning and she vomited repeatedly around 8 am, with bilious and non-bloody emesis. The pain continued throughout the day, leading her to present to the emergency department.
